channel.title: Data Science From Scratch on syknapptic
channel.description: Recent content in Data Science From Scratch on syknapptic

item.title: Programming Essentials - Variables
item.description: Variables R Python C++ Pure C++ Rcpp Variables R var_R <- 1 var_R ## [1] 1 Python var_PY <- 1 print(var_PY) ## [1] 1 C++ Pure C++ #include <iostream> int main() { int x_CPP = 1; std::cout << x_CPP; return 0; } Rcpp #include <Rcpp.h> // R to C++ to R interface // [[Rcpp::export]] int RCPP_function() { int x_RCPP = 1; return x_RCPP; } RCPP_function() # now accessible from R ## [1] 1

item.title: Variable Assignment
item.description: R Python C++ Pure C++ Rcpp R var_R <- 1 var_R ## [1] 1 Python var_PY <- 1 print(var_PY) ## [1] 1 C++ Pure C++ #include <iostream> int main() { int var_CPP = 1; std::cout << var_CPP; return 0; } Rcpp #include <Rcpp.h> // R to/from C++ interface // [[Rcpp::export]] int RCPP_function() { int var_RCPP = 1; return var_RCPP; } RCPP_function() # access the C++ function from R like any other function ## [1] 1

item.title: Essential Math
item.description: Our Test Values R Python C++ Sum R Python Length R Python Mean R Python Our Test Values R Here’s a numeric vector for our R code. x_R <- c(1.5, 2, 3.25, 4.9, 5, 6.1, 7.39, 8, 9.9) x_R ## [1] 1.50 2.00 3.25 4.90 5.00 6.10 7.39 8.00 9.90 Python Here’s a list of floats for our Python code. x_PY = [1.
